intro: Mastixia pentandra subsp. pentandra, commonly known as the Australian mastix tree, is a member of the Rutaceae family and is native to eastern Australia. It is a small to medium-sized tree that typically grows to a height of 5–15 meters, with smooth, greyish bark and lanceolate leaves that are often aromatic. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is well adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in coastal and dry forest habitats.
